meanings.sent1: She was paganizing the ancient statue by placing flowers around it.
meanings.sent2: The tribe started paganizing their rituals to honor nature spirits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was caught paganizing the family cat with a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to paganize the canvas, bringing life to the dull colors.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays paganized the landscape, turning it into a golden paradise.

meanings.definition: To convert (someone or something) to paganism.
meanings.sent1: The missionaries were paganizing the local population by introducing new beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts tell stories of kings paganizing entire kingdoms in the past.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly claimed he could paganize a rock into a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to paganize even the most skeptical minds.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody seemed to paganize the listeners, transporting them to another realm.
